data.question: What is the chemical formula of BUT-32?
What method was used for the structural determination of BUT-33?
At what temperature was BUT-33 synthesized for optimal yield?
What is the BET surface area of BUT-33?
Is BUT-33 more porous than BUT-32?
Does the addition of acetic acid affect the synthesis of BUT-33?
data.answer: Yes, the addition of acetic acid can lead to the formation of BUT-32 instead of BUT-33.

data.question: Can BUT-33 be used as a catalyst for carbon-carbon coupling reactions?
What is the yield of the cross-coupling product 3a when catalyzed by BUT-33?
Is BUT-33 stable under acidic and basic conditions?
What is the role of Ni(II) in the catalytic mechanism of BUT-33?
data.answer: Ni(II) reacts with Grignard reagent to form a homo-coupling product from an aryl-nickel intermediate.

data.question: Does BUT-33 maintain its crystallinity and porosity after catalysis?
What is the maximum temperature at which BUT-32 is thermally stable?
What is the space group of BUT-33?
Can BUT-33 be regenerated and reused in catalytic reactions?
What is the kinetic diameter of the smallest substrate used in the simulation for BUT-32 and BUT-33?
What is the effect of temperature on the synthesis rate of BUT-33?
data.answer: Higher temperature accelerates the transformation and leads to a faster formation of BUT-33.

data.question: Is the synthesis of BUT-33 affected by the presence of acetic acid?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of acetic acid can lead to the formation of BUT-32 instead.

data.question: What is the role of 1,2-dihaloethane in the catalytic cycle involving BUT-33?
data.answer: 1,2-dihaloethane is used as an oxidant to convert Ni(0) intermediates back to their active Ni(II) state.

data.question: Does the synthesis of BUT-33 involve a kinetically controlled process?
What is the crystal system of BUT-33?
